intro: Cabralea polytricha var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered cabralea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
